snippet: Regardless of whether sequester cuts are lifted or reduced, the defense secretary indicated that the Army and Air Force would most likely shrink.
abstract: Defense Sec Chuck Hagel warns if across-the-board budget cuts remain in place, United States will have to reduce its global security objectives by reducing size of its armed forces or its edge in technology as Pentagon seeks to remain solvent; says also that size of Army and Air Force are likely to shrink regardless.
lead_paragraph: Regardless of whether sequester cuts are lifted or reduced, the defense secretary indicated that the Army and Air Force would most likely shrink.

headline.main: Hagel Gives Dire Assessment of Choices He Expects Cuts to Force on the Pentagon
headline.print_headline: Hagel Gives Dire Assessment of Choices He Expects Cuts to Force on the Pentagon

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
